review: It's a roll of the dice whenever I come here sometimes it's perfect other times just okay. I guess it depends on who is working at the time. This time I came and sat at the bar. Ordered my drinks plus food. Drinks were OK. Ordered a Long Island and I wasn't thrilled on how it was made. Everyone can't make a Long Island. Only half of my food came out I had to ask for my side order which I'm assuming they forgot. I also ordered jack daniels ribs to go & can you believe they forgot the jack daniels sauce smh. Again coming here is like a roll of the dice.

Women Be Warned! Don't complain or you will be given a token Appetizer card and then the Manager - Rob McKeeithan - will say "So, am I forgiven? Give me a hug to prove it!". He will then proceed to put his arms around you, chest to chest without waiting for a response.  Corporate has yet to respond since I reported this on 11/5.   Since this behavior seems acceptable as Friday's has chosen to ignore the issue, don't go there unless you want to be assaulted.

This place is just...sad. We walked in behind another couple. The hostess was just taking them to their table, and asked another employee (who was sitting there near the entry) to take us to one. This employee snapped back about not clocking in for another few minutes. The hostess left with the other couple without saying anything back. But then the unprofessional one stood up, coughed all over without covering her mouth, and took us to a table anyway. I didn't even want to touch the menus at that point. A waitress came over promptly and was nice enough, but when we asked for another minute, she took 10 before returning. The food took forever, and arrived lukewarm at best. My husband's fries were cold. The 'crispy Brussels sprouts' I ordered were really salty and pretty much inedible. What I presume was cheese in my mashed potatoes had also started to solidify due to not being hot.  Our waitress had checked on us before we'd really gotten a bite in, so we didn't realize just how off the meal was. And then she vanished again. I had to wave her down from across the room for the check. At that point, we didn't want to wait 20 min for her to find a manager. The meal had already taken way longer than it should have. Ironically, we just got a $50 gift card to Fridays this week, and we don't even want to use it. That's how poor an impression this place has left on us. We're just going to give it away. After equally bad experiences with the Willow Grove Fridays, we were hoping that was an isolated issue and this one would be better. We we wrong.

I never expect much from this kind of restaurant.  We had Parmesan and Garlic wings and a Cobb Salad.  The wings were really, really good.  The Cobb Salad was okay.  Service was mediocre, but our waiter realized it and comped us dessert.  He gets high marks.

This place is just terrible. I sat at the bar and got endless apps. We sat here for close to ten minutes before the bartender appeared again. I watched 3 people send back their food and if I felt like complaining, I would have been the 4th. The bartender was clearly overworked and annoyed at the kitchen (as he should be).  The post stickers' outing was tough as if they weren't fully steamed; or freezer burnt....I'm honestly unsure.

So much has changed with TGI FRIDAYS... It's so disappointing, the best part of my visit was being seated a.s.a.p, Thats why only one start. Other then that I waited 15 min for my drink, then I placed my order that was another 30 min. Then when it did arrived, I was shocked by the fact that they don't give you many fries on the plate. And a freind of mind ask to substitute the reg fries for potato fries. The waitress says we don't sell potato fries anymore. Then he ask waitress for baked potato instead, she says we don't sell baked potatos anymore. I was somewhat speechless that a business this type don't even sell baked potatos anymore.  Then after was done eating I received my check. When I gave the girl the money I waited over 40 min just to receive my change. I like TGI FRIDAYS mabe at another location I'll try.

Wasn't the best, but wasn't totally the worst. Got seated within minutes, but the service slowed down almost immediately after that. It was a good 5+ minutes before we even seen our waiter. Got the Endless Apps (Mozzarella Sticks, Chicken Quesadillas, and Pot Stickers) and BBQ'n Burger. Initially forgot the onion rings that go on the burger, which is part of the reason it's $12. Other than that, the food was a little above average. Again, nothing special. Probably won't be heading to this restaurant again in the near future.

Came in for lunch around 12pm and server with glasses, slender body and long black hair in braids, everything was fine until I questioned her on a breakdown of the bill. I was not debating the price but more of an explanation of how they came up with the amount. She become nasty & defensive, rolling her eyes, huffing & puffing (what are you a child) and had the damn nerve to say that I added the bill up wrong!! Who is the server, me or you?! I work as H.R in the restaurant field and if she was my employee would be sent home & lose 2 shifts!! Number one rule in the hospitality field is - NEVER ARGUE OR GO BACK & FORTH WITH A CUSTOMER!!  She must have missed the memo in training!! She needs a coaching & a redirect. The manager was a slightly older lady with short blonde hair in a ponytail she came to see what happened; but sadly the damage was already done. Enjoy your tip!

I wish I could rate this a Zero. We came during happy hour and the bar was nearly empty. One bartender and no server at the bar. After a long wait we ordered mozzarella stick as an app, 4 pieces one of which was empty breading. One of our party ordered a chicken sandwich that came out looking like a hockey puck. We sent it back for one that would be correctly that took a half hour. We were here for over two hours. They comped the chicken sandwich but at this point who cares.  Never again

The positives, they take reservations. I have been going to TGIFriday - Bensalem since it opened and thru all the incarnations.  Seated promptly with reservations, then waited 20 minutes for a server and another 15 for soft drinks. Tried all you can eat appetizers. They came out 5 minutes before the entree. Reordered app and that was out fairly quick. Se rver took some time to return and we had to wait for ketchup and mustard. An adjacent table was having some issues and it required manager, hostess and server while all the tables around them were ignored.  Will think long and hard about returning and especially since this location is directly next to a casino. The food was decent.

Went for a late lunch today after work, got the unlimited apps...the fried pickles were really good and so were the boneless wings, the potstickers left a lot to be desired and the mozzarella sticks were average...we got drinks that were pretty good, my Cosmo was good, but I had a hard time trying to switch the Patron from silver to represado...my friend got the lava flow and that was fantastic. Since it was the middle of the day the restaurant was mostly empty yet our waiter was hard to find when we needed him. It wasn't bad and I would go back, but I've definitely had better.

Perfect family restaurant. Came here with my wife, son and his friend. Nice atmosphere and food. I love the Jack Daniels food menu.. Ask for Sean the waiter, he was very nice, energetic and had great suggestions for the menu.

Went Christmas bight. Not crowed at all. Waitress not very polite. Ordered steak, came out xold as did chicken my husband ordered. Told server. No apologies  or anything..just " i brought it out right away". 15 minutes later new steak and chicken  Chicken hot, steak luke warm. Got manager. Very rude and not apologetic at all. Told me steak done in a minute. Came back, steak warmer but not medium rare as server told him. Didn't care. Server got other manager Marco. Very apologetic.   Not very happy

Visiting family In Philly from NJ. My husband and I wanted to watch the Jets game with our son. They were so accommodating to us and friendly. Great customer service. Thank you Bensalem TGIF for this wonderful experience.  P.S Jets loss

The worst service from all staff, front of house, and bartenders. Cold food! Even came back cold for a second time. Damn heat lamps! Salad, soup and burger pre-made.  The burger was like a hockey puck and forgot to bring my toppings. Fries were cold, brought a second order with no seasoning.  French onion was bland and not melted cheese. Caesar was soggy.  Cmon people. It's a burger soup and salad get it together. I do not recommend this place. The bartender just asked if I'd like another drink white her mouthful. Christine. The opposite of a delight. I'm watching the bartenders serve a man who is sleeping at the bar. He does not need another large beer. This place should be visited by the state and food inspectors.

Got a cheeseburger and fries- it was good! Friendly server and he was attentive to any questions we had. We were seated near both the kitchen entrance and the hostess stand, so we heard a good amount of personal (loud) conversation but if it's not too busy I can't blame them when there's so many staffed with what seems like not too much to do. Only other bad side was that we ordered something on the side and they forgot it but when we mentioned it the server was very apologetic.

We were returning from a day in Philadelphia to our homes in Buck county. It was dinner time so we agreed to look for a place to eat. We passed up a few other restaurants that had long wait times to be seated.  We spotted a TGIF Fridays and quickly decided to stop for a bite. To our parties amazement, we were quickly seated, and that's when the experience started to go downhill. The table was sticky and on further inspection so was the floor. Evidently an earlier patron spilled their beer. While gazing at the sticky stains I sized up the general cleanliness of my surroundings.  It looked as if they had not swept or washed the floors for who knows when. Trash and various pieces and parts off of the bussed plates were everywhere.  The waitress was obviously overworked and unsmiling.  She took our drink orders and reappeared in what seemed like 10-15 minutes. While waiting for her to return with our beverages, we collectively had ample time to take in the menu. I'll admit that it's been a while since I last visited a TGIF's... but WOW the prices were outrageous. This is definitely NOT a fine dining restaurant. We finally settled on some of the apps and smaller portion dinner entries.  The four of us were equally disappointed with the quality of our offerings, Which ranged from the Jack-sliders to the Chipotle Yucatan chicken salad, and two of the Bruschetta chicken pasta. The sliders contained questionable (mystery )meat and were over cooked. The salad was dry and flavorless, the chicken desert dry. The pasta was undercooked as well. If you spot a TGIF Friday's run, don't walk, as fast as your little legs can take you, in a direction far, far away from this nightmare.  You may thank God that it's Friday... you'll thank yourself for passing on this insult to dining.

Decided to get a take out order, picked up when they requested  me to.  Ordered ribs and shrimp, salad, potato skin.  Received only ribs, fries, potato skins were all ice cold.  Salad no dressing, just lettuce.  Get there they make me wait 15 minutes, bring out the condiments they forgot, mind you they took my order back.  So I am waiting 45 minutes still no food.  Horrible service.

Don't order pick up from here unless you want to get dinner from somewhere else after you pick up your stuff. What good is a salad with no dressing and a burger where you put all the toppings I requested not to have.

The Jack Daniel's Ribeye will make you crave it nightly! The Jack Daniels sauce is like crack for us fat guys, great appetizers, great meals and great desserts! I try to get here 2x's a month to slam their delicious food into my mouth!

First time went with friends who were visiting from Britain and the food was ok, nothing special. Waitresses seemed unhappy to be there. Drinks were very watered down. I didn't care to go back, but another day a group of friends wanted to go and my husband and I agreed figuring maybe we'd gone on a bad night?  Nope. Worse service ever. Some of us were served while others waited long periods between being served. I was served last after everyone was finished eating. We all had to ask for silverware and the waitress only gave us 4 when there were 6 of us. She forgot our drinks repeatedly and we had to ask for napkins as well. Same deal with the food and drinks, nothing special. It was a dead night too, so not sure why th service was so bad. Will not go back.

Seated right away then waited 15min to see the server and 10 more minutes to get our drinks. The food was poorly prepared and was a McDonald's level of quality.  I've been eating here for 15 years and the service and quality of food has been going down hill over the past year.

Absolutely terrible. This place went down hill fast!! I went here many times over the years, and had about a 5 year hiatus since this last visit. I'll stick to the facts- but everything they did (or didn't do) seemed to top the last disappointing thing.  We were sat right away, which was the only positive. We ordered a French onion soup to start, and a Bloody Mary. Both took well over 20 minutes. The soup, I can understand. The drink- the waitress had in her hand while chatting casually for 5+ minutes before dropping off to our table! Watered down by that point. The onion soup was embarrassing. No crusty cheese, just broth. We thought it was an error! But, no, they assured us this was their normal presentation. Cannot comment on taste as it was not appetizing enough to try. Skip to salad. Our salads not only came with wrong ingredients (red onions instead of green- big breath difference). Asked for tomatoes and got two measly cherry tomatoes. Also- dressing on the side? Never came! Told the waiter immediately upon delivery who apologized and said he would grab it. Fast forward 10 min, still no sight of waiter. I physically had to find a random worker to get our dressing. Disappointing all around.

I've been to this establishment several times but by far this has been the worst" I will not go back. Where should I start? I asked for a Gluten-Free menu when walking through the door as I did not need to wait since my party had already been seated. The hostess looked through the drawer and finally found an 'Allergy Free' menu. She handed it to me and I proceeded to my table. This is the worst, hard to read menu I've ever seen. Do not expect help from it. You need to have and rely on your on knowledge anyway. Long story short..... Asked for Margarita with NO salt, came back with salt and very weak, small glass, a lot of ice ( asked for little ice). So weak and small, drank it in less than 2 minutes. Waitress came by and said, " OMG, is there a hole in that glass!" ( how dare she) I said, "It's so weak, all ice and I am not allowed to have salt!" She went to get another one, same thing except no salt. This whole episode lasted 20 minutes. Mind you, place was almost empty at 1:00 p.m. on a Tuesday afternoon.  She finally took our orders. My order, food runner messed up bc I asked for steamed spinach instead of Cole slaw due to food allergies, guess what came out!? Waitress caught it, waited 10 minutes for that. While waiting for that, other party waited 20 minutes for extra dressing for a dry salad. When she received it, I was finished my meal. Shame, I am usually a decent tipper, not this time. Poor service for an almost empty restaurant. Used to be okay, not now, not for lunch anyway!

Sadly, since the inception of the new streamlined menu and the remodeling of this TGIF, the menu is more that of a burger bar and the options for sides has been greatly reduced. The broccoli that my wife and I ordered was so rubbery that it was not eatable. One pasta dish on the menu now and the steak and shrimp that we loved is now steak with shrimp as an added side. Lastly, there were new servers there on our last two visits. The one brought our appetizer to us after we were half way through our meal because she forgot about it and the server who took our complaint about the broccoli let us know that she didn't make it. Needless to say, TGIF is no longer on our list of places to dine at. There are far too many restaurants that will appreciate our business.

So I keep hoping things will change. Went back a few times must be a glutton for punishment. A few visits ago I ordered barbecue chicken salad it took a half an hour the chicken came out and it was raw they forgot half of the stuff that was supposed to go on the  salad finally got the manager over she ended up comping my salad. Went back this past Sunday evening lots of people waiting to be seated but yet lots of empty tables that needed to be cleaned off. I had my granddaughter with us she wanted to get some chocolate milk they were out of milk how do you run out of milk. We asked for something else that they also ran out of can't remember what it was...whoever is running this joint needs a refresher on how to manage a restaurant.

We stopped going to this specific location because they just don't measure up to other locations we've been to (i.e. Willow Grove). My  last visit was the worst. I ordered a skillet meal and the veg was completely raw. Instead of making a new order, they recooked my meal so the veg was now crispy burnt. It was the same plate because I noticed my chicken was still cut like when I originally tasted it. My husband was dissapointed in his dish also. We just go to Willow Grove now.

Went twice in the past 2 weeks and the only reason I did that is because I haven't been there in years so I said why not on Labor Day... Waited to be sat forever. Waitress was nice but they were short staffed so service was horrible... She never took one dish off of the table bill was 100 definitely not worth it ... Second time I went because I had to meet my boss there for a meeting .Same thing short staffed and bartender seemed to have a attitude problem he was nice for the most part maybe he was annoyed with something else but not professional. Anyways will not ever eat there again 2 times in one month is a No for me ... Food is Ok and they need to work on there staff
I was hungry and is Friday. Out 4 lunch me my girlfriend was very happy. We enjoyed good food and smile your . We will be back

My husband and I go here quite often and it's usually ok, food is ok and the restaurant itself is ok and the waitstaff is usually ok. We came in on Friday and got a fabulous server, Carly she was exceptional. She was all over refilling drinks, she was friendly, fun, she got the orders correct, she checked on us a lot but not an annoying amount. Ask for her! Thanks girlie!

The food was mediocre at best. The appetizers were undercooked and had a presentation of being rushed out of the kitchen. The server was nice but very absent minded and forgetful!  The manager was not doing what he should be doing which is going around to tables ensuring satisfaction. Clearly a lack of disregard.

This is now the 3rd time, I've come to this establishment and they mess up my entire order, it's like they disregard the order taken & do whatever they want. The management team are just as rude and I can see why they continuously give bad service along with not following directions. I placed an order to go, the receipts clearly reads my order correct bc I had the girl run my order back. I get my food & it's completely different. Stupid shit. Screw this place.

I wanted to take a moment to thank the wait staff at Fridays Bensalem for the excellent service provided for my friends and myself for our 53rd class reunion on Saturday 18 Feb 2017. There were 25 of us, and I know what a nightmare that can be for the wait staff, but they handled it with professionalism and patience. The trips back and forth through this crew had to be exasperating, but you'd never know  by how well they managed it. They are to be commended on their skill and great representation of the Fridays franchise. Please share our gratitude and appreciation for helping to make our day a huge success.

My family of 4 have been to this restaurant 3 times in the past two weeks. Each time we have purchased 1 meal and ordered two endless appetizers. ALL 3 times the managers explained that if no one was getting a meal then each person at the table would be charged $10 each for the endless apps. But if 1 meal was ordered then we would only be charged for two endless apps at $10 each.  Today we were told by the manager on duty that we couldn't do that. Every person would be charged $10 if they didn't get a meal ($40) even though we were only getting two apps ($20 value). My problem is the inconsistency with their policy and lack of communication with each other. The rules of every promotion should be well known by the managers at the very least.

Food is pretty good.. went on a Sunday  around 5.. wasn't  too busy. Was seated immediately. Of course the football game was on and everyone was at the bar drinking and then an argument broke out between two women. The waiter we had was hilarious. He definitely earned his tip. Will go again but probably not on a day when the football game is on lol

Our server Bethany was very non attentive. Didn't even greet us until after sitting for 10 minutes. Took our drink orders and food, waited 15 minutes and our drinks still weren't out. Someone else brought our food and we told her we hadn't gotten our drinks yet and she was very nice and apologized and got our drinks and sent a manager over. A male manager came over and was very emotionless, apologized and didn't even give us free drinks. Then, Bethany came over and checked on us, and we asked for a box, she brought it out with no check, so we had to wave a manager over to ask for our check. And this whole time it wasn't even busy.

I travel a great deal for work and usually eat at Friday's several times a month and this location is the worst for service. I am always disappointed when I come here the staff act like it is not there job to assist you.
This place is dirty! Fruit flies at the bar. Service is inattentive. Bar top is dirty, dust on the shelves and bottles. Stay away!

What happened here?! I used to be a regular and cloudlnt get enough of their half rack ribs with sirloin and sweet potato fries /Cole slaw. Boy oh boy did things change around here. Monday night, not busy at all. They're out of sirloin at 8 a clock??? Ok I'll order the rib eye instead. Medium. The Chef decides I should get extra well done with bitter burnt corners. The ribs are unrecognizable. Completely burnt. Mashed potatoes have no seasoning. Sigh. And to think we waited 45 minutes after appetizers for our enteres. And we ordered entrees and apps at the same time. No wonder it's empty here. Run Forrest run!! Don't ever come here

The table wasn't cleared or cleaned when we were seated.  Once we were seated the chairs and table were so wobbly that drinks spilled overtime anyone leaned on the table.     After we were seated, the waitress took our drink order and disappeared.  We waited almost 10 minutes for our drinks to arrive and when they did I was given the wrong beer; for which it took an additional 15 minutes before anyone attempted to correct it.   My portion of Norwegian Salmon for which I was charged $21 was approximately 1" wide by 4" long and wouldn't be considered anything more than a half portion by any reasonable standards. The  1/2 rack of ribs were more like a 1/4 rack of ribs. If you want to sit at the bar and eat appetizer all night you would probably be fine.  If you are looking for a place to take your family to dinner...there are both better food and better pricing elsewhere.

This place has really gone downhill. They used to have a great menu, packed with diverse meals.  Their portions used to be huge.  The staff used to be energetic, friendly, and eager to please.  The food used to be served promptly and brought to your table at the same time so everyone could eat their meals together. Sadly, "used to be" is the key phrase here. My family and I came here for dinner a few days ago.  From the moment we sat down to when we walked out the door we were shaking our heads.  In summary: I asked for a large beer.  Got a small glass of beer.  Ordered French onion soups.  Got bowls of someone's "interpretation" of French onion soup instead.  Namely, a small bowl of cold broth with a piece of cheese covered bread floating in it.  My family were served theirs, while I waited about five minutes for mine to eventually arrive.  My daughter's salad? Arrived few minutes after that.  Also, soups were brought with teaspoons, not soup spoons. Meals also arrived one at a time, many minutes apart.  All the while, we watched the wait staff standing around, talking to each other.  Most were giggling with one another, occasionally hugging one another like they were at a party or something.  They seemed "put upon" to go and take care of their tables. Our waitress? Never even asked us if we wanted dessert.  Or refills for our drinks.  Or if our we were happy with our meals.  She was VERY quick to bring us the check and get our payment though.  No doubt she was eager to get back to her conversation with another waitress she was chatting with by the kitchen entrance.  Shame on us for pulling her away! The only really positive part of the whole experience was watching the menagerie of staff when they managed to break away from their conversations and actually go take orders or serve food.  We gave them all names as they passed our table.  Here's a few: "Tattoo Arm," "Nose Ring," "Hugs a Lot," "Laughs too Much," "Barely Legal," and "Almost Dropped Everything." Add one more "used to be" to the list.  Namely, we "used to be" here to eat.

I'm a huge fan of Friday's .. I used to go there at least a few times a night back home and I just moved here a couple weeks ago .. I've been to this fridays now about four times and it is absolutely the worst place you could possibly go ever... I'm still a fan of Friday's but this one is as bad as it could possibly get .. ordering drinks at the bar is a nightmare and I've sat about 15 to 30 Minutes in between drinks at least a few times now .. the food is good as always but good luck getting it in a reasonable time frame .. one word of advice never order the endless wings because by the time the second order comes out you'll be ready to leave ... also the worst thing about this place besides the extremely terrible service is the fruit flies .. there are everywhere ! Over your food your beer and constantly flying around it's bs! The worst part is I'm A huge fridays fan but this place has some serious issues.. I would assume it starts with management . God knows where they are

My family went here after my sons Confirmation. There was 8 of us so we called ahead to let them know we were coming about 20 minuets in advance. By the time we arrived they had a table ready for us and seated us immediately. Our waitress was so nice and made my son feel special. The food took a bit to come out but it was worth the wait. I got the NY Strip and shrimp. It was reasonably priced and cooked perfectly.
Not at all pleased with the service tonight.  Slow,  inept,  just poor.  Not visiting location again.

I honestly don't enjoy giving bad reviews.  I've been to this location now 2-3 times while mostly average service and your expected tgifridays food- not stellar, but decent.  This last time I went I was on my way back from a long drive and decided to get car side to go.  I called and asked to place a to go order and was immediately placed on hold, then after a couple minutes disconnected.  Ok, accidents happen, I call back and tell them I was on hold to place a to go order and disconnected-put on hold again.  This time for just over 7 minutes- I know because I was close to hanging up when they finally picked back up to take my order.  I order an appetizer sampler and 2 orders of cheesy chicken one with shrimp- told 25 mins.  I get there early and wait in car, go inside just after time I'm told it will be ready and told to wait at the bar and someone would bring my order right out.  Close to another 10 mins go by.  I scan the receipt- all looks good, pay and go.  I drive home open the bag- and appetizer is right but I have chicken fingers instead of second chicken entrée.  So I call up get the manager, she asks if I want to drive back, (I don't- I'm finally home), she offers to send out a gift card for the dish & takes my address.  This was now a few weeks ago and I've yet to see a gift card in the mail.  I was holding off on this review but drove by today and it reminded me I never got the gift card.  So yeah, I'm going to go back for my food I paid for, but what a mess, from start to finish- so many balls dropped.  I'm always one to give the benefit of the doubt for human error, but this place needs to get it together.

Went to this location for dinner, we sat at the table bar, cause it's faster, thats what we thought, took them forever to clean the table, and the drama followed, very slow taking orders, bringing food and even when we wanted to get out there and pay, don't go there unless your time is worth nothing and you want a lousy service.

After calling ahead for reservations, my girlfriend and I were good to sit for over half an hour. Once we approached the counter to inquire about our seating, as several cord had come in after us and been seated, we were informed that they had "already called our name." Sitting less than ten feet away from the counter and paying attention the entire time to the hostess, it was apparent that our name was never called. When confronted with this fact, the make host made zero accommodations to try to fit us in and told us we would have to wait until the next day was available... On a Saturday night at 7pm. Ha yeah right. Rather to waiting the hour to find the next "open table for two," we decided to leave and will refuse to come back. We should have just gone to Friendly's like we planned...

Horrible. Appetizers (which were cold) came out with the food. Fries tasted like a whole box of salt was dumped on them. Will never ever go here again!! A manager came out, for what reason, I don't know. She asks I hear you're not happy with your potstickers, ok I'll take them off of your bill! Did I say I'm never going back? Never!

Went there for "quick" lunch on a Saturday around noon (was there for nearly two hours...seriously???). I'll make this simple: the service was a disaster, the food was bad, it took a really long time to get one simple appetizer for two people to share, and it smelled dirty in that restaurant (noticed it immediately when we walked in; should have left then). Mop a floor once in a while...jeez. I'll never go back. Yuck!!

The food is decent, not great but it's decent for a chain. But the wait is ridiculous. We sat at our table of ten people for 45 minutes before we got our water, then it was another 30 minutes wait to get our food. The restaurant is not crowded either. With that said, I'd consider doing the 2 for $16 deal as the potstickers were pretty good.

Last 3 experiences here have been terrible.  Most recent experience was when my boyfriend and I went with another couple for dinner.  After being seated, we waited over an hour for our food. When our food finally arrived, we had rotten tomatoes in our salad and hot sauce poured all over where it didn't belong. The food was not worth the wait. The service wasn't any better.  There was a special on a certain draft beer - making it the same price for two sizes of the beer.  The waitress brought us out the smaller size, twice, and told us that it was okay because it was the same price (even though we were getting a smaller glass). This visit will be our last to this location. It's a pity because it's so close to home.

Incomplete review because we left before we even got a chance to eat. Service is God-awful and we literally couldn't stand waiting anymore. #1: we stood in the lobby like 3 minutes before a hostess appeared. Instead some other staff member talked to someone else on the phone right in front of 4 waiting guests.  #2: we waited 20 minutes outside for a table when there were maybe 1/4 open tables in the place. We did overhear an explanation from a hostess to another group of annoyed guests that they had a no-show and their manager couldn't make it in. Kind of crazy that two missing staff members would cripple a TGI Friday's on a Friday... #3: we were then seated and waited another 20 minutes while not 1 but 2 parties, one of four and one of eight, were both seated, greeted, and had their drinks brought to them while we sat completely forgotten by any staff. Then we left. I'm sorry is this the type of place where you have to literally stand up and object to your neglect before anybody pays attention to you? Long story short will never be coming back to this place. One star is one too many.

Terrible....35 minute for appetizers...wings warm at best. Waited over 1 hour for burgers, 2 of which came out cold. Steak cold, had to be sent back! Onion soup with no onions??  Never again!! Oh, and the bill came out to $180.00...for what????????????

I am so disgusted with the service and professionalism of this location, if given the opportunity I don't think one star is even worth giving.  On March 13th 2015 my boy-friend and I decided to come to this establishment to celebrate his graduation night and all of his recent achievements. Before placing our appetizers my friend had ordered a House Long Island Ice Tea (LIIT). As our waitres brought out the appetizer my friend had ordered another LIIT. After sharing a few appetizers our entrees came out and that's when my friend had ordered another LIIT. Towards the end of our meal and before wanting to order desert our waitress had asked us if we needed anything else and my friend asked for another LIIT and she softly said let me ask if they will "let" you have another one, confused she walked away and within' a few minutes a man I'm assuming was the manager came with the check and asked us if we needed anything else.  We proceeded and told him that we had asked our waitess for another LIIT and didn't know what the problem was...and he proceeded to say how he couldn't serve us any more drinks due to the amount we have already ordered and left.  Now, being a business owner myself I understand that "if" there were a 3 limit drink in the companies policy then their decision this night is understandable. But that wasn't the case. If my friend had acted ill mannered due to his alcohol consumption such as speaking sluggish, not being able to walk or stand I would understand that limiting his drinks is in his best intrest but again that definitely wasn't the case. We are adults and would like to be treated with the respect that we are responsible enough to know our limits.  If there were any concern for my friend and his alcohol consumption they could of approached us more professionally. Such as, asking if my friend was driving or if he was okay. But both the waitress and manager fail to do so.  Overall, I feel very upset over this situation and will be taking it to corporate. I will never return to this location and if your trying to enjoy your night and not be told what you can handle I suggest you don't come here as well!

Was in the area for a business trip.  Walked here from the research facility just behind this TGI's.  At that time, around July 2013, they were renovating the restaurant or something.  Came in and they gave us a booth.  Very friendly servers.  I also think this is a reflection of the community as well. As for lunch, they had a lunch menu.  I think I went with the burger.  Real good stuff.  Salty, but it's a good option for lunch.

For starters, I want to make it clear that I love TGI Fridays as a whole- I've been to several and have pretty much always enjoyed myself. With that being said, this is by far the worst TGI I've ever stepped foot in. I travel a lot for work and often stay in hotels so I'm always looking for a decent meal at a reasonable price. It wasn't incredibly busy- a semi-full restaurant on a Wednesday night. I asked for a seat at the bar and was told to seat myself but when I went up the bar was full. I walked back to the hostess and asked her for a table instead since there was no room at the bar and she told me I'd have to wait as she stood waiting to seat the couple that was walking up to the restaurant from outside. So I stood another 5 minutes waiting to be seated at any one of many open tables. Still not a big deal, until I sat at my table for 15 minutes before anyone approached me to take my drink order. When my waitress came up she was fairly rude, she just walked up to my table and stared at me without saying anything. Taking the hint that I wasnt even going to get a "hello" I went ahead and gave her my drink order and my food order for the Endless Apps right away. I then waited another 20 minutes for my drink as I sat eating my food. None of this would have been an issue if it weren't for the fact that 1) the weren't very busy as previously stated and 2) i watched my waitress stand around talking to coworkers with her back turned to me. Very glad I found this location through my travels because I would never come here again.
$10 for a beer and ribs. Ribs are super tender and fall right off the bone. Had nachos and they also hit the spot. Right next to park casino. Show your park card and get $5 off your bill

Went the other day for my sons birthday dinner I was in the bathroom the past 3 days same good taste new terrible stomach aches not sure if it was the food or the concoction they called a Long Island which def was not a Long Island

Food has gone way downhill. They no longer pretend the food isn't frozen and mass marketed. Service is usually good but slow ... bartenders are the only reason we bother to come here (though we much prefer Applebee's down the street anymore).

I visited the restaurant tonight.  We were seated right away. We waited about 10 minutes before a waitress came to the table.  The excuse was that they just switched waitresses. We ordered our food it took a while for the food to come. The order was wrong.  We had to ask for silverware, the ketch up bottle was empty and the service was slow. It wasn't like the restaurant was crowded.  The waitress did not check on the table until we lodged a complaint. I  will not come back to this restaurant.

So disappointed. Spicy Craft Beer Cheeseburger was mostly bun. A stale wanna be Brioche bun. Great tasting beef but to quote my husband "a Xerox copy probably had more meat".  I love the Ginger Lime slaw but at the minute quantities the good parts getting lost behind the shadows of what could have been, I'll pass. The only value here is endless apps. But unlimited fried wings and potato skins isn't what I call a dinner. I'll be waiting TGI Fridays to get your act together.

The waitress was friendly and attentive but the food was awful. I ordered a steak dinner with steamed broccoli, a small salad in place of potatoes. The  rare steak was cooked perfectly, cool red center.  I took one bite and thought the meat was spoiled. After clearing my palate by eating the vegetables I took another bite and was certain the meat was spoiled.  I do not recommend this place unless you are just there for cocktails.

Never again. There was short blonde hair in my food. I'm a long haired brunette. The waitress came out and after telling her about it, she took it back. The cook brought my food out to me in a go-to container instead of on a plate... My family was still eating their food. Then the waitress came out saying that the manager was going to give us the one appetizer that we asked for that we were supposed to get for  free with our coupon ( mozzarella sticks) for free and another appetizer...We were never given our mozzarella sticks and they took the next cheapest appetizer off instead of my burger off. What a ripoff. Then I emailed their corporate earlier this evening about the issue and it was almost like getting an automatic a few hours later.

I went there for a late night date with my husband and I was extremely disappointed... Waited over 30 minutes for our food ! The appetizer came out at the same time as our main entrees and its was all COLD!!!  I will never ever return to this location and if you can help it find another location or restaurant!!! I enjoyed my water and lime... That's all!!!

$10 endless actually means (1) you get to choose from only 5 items (2) the second round means you only receive half the amount of food (3) the time in between receiving your new round of half-ass apps increases (4) the longer you wait the worse they taste.  I now understand why this is Friday's is so close to the casino...you're taking a chance going there.
They need a little help okay alot of help. Already spoke to district manager regarding the horrible horrible service.

Used to be my favorite spot but no more. Since the upgrade the menu is HORRIBLE. Menu is literally ONE page. The waiter thought trying to act like my friend would compensate for the piss poor service he gave me on my 1st lunch date with my daughter. Food arrived cold. But that was to be expected since I waited all day for it. Do yourself a favor, GO SOME WHERE ELSE. Tgif is NOT the same. I HATE to go somewhere for a good meal especially when I'm hungry and get this crappy experience. Definitely lost a LOYAL customer.

My experience here was possibly the worst I've ever had at any chain restaurant ever! Upon my arrival I was told there would be a 20-25 minute wait. Noticing the large amountsl of open tables, I inquired why the wait? I was informed that the manager had told the hostess to hold everyone because the kitchen was running behind. Now I get that if it was slammed packed he might say something like that. It wasn't packed to say the least. Well my wife and I waited for the 20 or do minutes. Then for some reason all of those tables were open and everyone got seated. All at once mind you. We sat down and since it was so "busy"decided to order our drinks and food at the same time. My wife ordered a hot tea with extra lemon. I ordered a 22oz. Beer. We waited and waited... so I went to the bar after 10 minutes and ordered the same beer I ordered. Brought it to my seat, only for the server to show up with my wife's tea with my beer. My wife ordered her tea with extra  lemon.. nope how about no lemon. Now in the ordering process nobody asked which tea was offered but I had no idea there was a choice. My wife received Chai. All she wanted was normal black or green tea. Informed the waitress who changed it promptly. I had ordered a app sampler. Which 10 mins. later arrived and cold. They microwaved the heck out of the marinara sauce to the point of it being sticky and dry! I've never seen that before. We muddled through the app even though it was cold, hoping for a hot meal. My wife ordered a BBQ chicken salad, and I ordered a simple fried chicken sandwich. After another 5-10 minutes they showed up. Wouldn't you know, my meal was cold and even her chicken on the salad was cold. Also she was never asked what dressing she required so it showed up dry!! Dry!! And looked like crap on a plate!!! I called the "manager" over znd he agreed the meals were cold, we left soon after. It seemed that the bar got the largest attention and everyone else second. Worst experience ever!! I will not be returning and I pray for your souls if you try this place out!!
Not impressed! Service was horrible!It took forever to get our food, and it just wasn't that great! Won't be going there again, at least not that location.

Never going back. Went with a friend and got a 3 appetizer platter. Food was not good and not very hot. Desserts were very expensive for the taste, quality and quantity. Server was polite but a little hard to find sometimes. Applebees is better and less expensive.

You get here what you expect from a typical Fridays.  Staff was friendly and nice. It wasn't a very busy night and after we finished our dinner the waitress did not rush us and let us sit. Mainly decided to write this review as to let the kitchen know not to use the entire romaine lettuce to make a salad.  The white rooty tip of the romaine is not consumed by the general population should not be included in a salad.  This wasn't just an accident that happened on my plate.  I found multiple different ends pieces of the lettuce in my salad.  Id rather you give me a smaller salad, it's annoying and makes the salad not very appetizing.  Until that is fixed salad not recommended.

Came here for my brother's birthday. We made reservations so we didn't have to wait to be seated...but then waited for 20 minutes for our drink order.. another 20 to order appetizers and another 20 to order food. When the food was finally served to us they brought everything out one by one.. and very slowly,  so slow that one of us were already finished our meal before a child even got theirs (which they claim that it was burnt so they had to remake it, but it was mac & cheese, pretty sure he never put his order in). I had the chicken and cheese but it tasted old.. reminded me of stale everything, I swear it tasted like a nursing home smells. I will never ever go back there again. Absolutely horrible service and food. I used to really like this Fridays I don't know what they are doing different but the past 3 times I've been here nothing about it has been good. Go to the restaurant across the street from here don't waste your time or your money here.

Just like any other food franchise the food was A-Ok, the service was good though, we had a really nice waitress who I thought was very nice and you could tell she was a happy person! Me and my girlfriend both ordered the Spinach dip which, is delightful, but we know its not made on the premises, most likely it was frozen then heated to melt it, and the chips were dropped in the deep fryer. I ended up getting the Brisket which was some what fatty, with a side of the loaded fries and the macaroni an cheese. My girlfriend got a grilled chicken with a side of mash potatoes. All in all the service was good, I'm not one to go to man chain restaurants like this, but a person I work with gave us a coupon so i decided to use it.

This location has diminished,  prices raised,  portions lessened, and service disappeared. The past few times I've been there, there has always been an issues. (And the last two times they had less than 5 tables filled, as it was lunch time). The wait staff will disappear and now come back til they're serving the food, or giving ur check, as if you might not need anything else. And i dont know how many times I have to remind them even when I do ask for a refill, or something to be brought. Terrible!
Tables are too short or chairs are too high.. Ended up hunched over and uncomfotable during lunch. Food and service was very good. Will have to sit in a booth next.

Ok honestly I downloaded the yelp app just to review this place. The food and drinks were fine but I could NOT get over the nerve of our server had. It was the end of the night, and I understand how that is. I'm a server myself and I've also worked as a restaurant manager. But that does not ever make it okay to treat your last table like garbage. Our server (I think her name was Olivia?) totally ignored us and didn't even ask me if I wanted another drink until I had already finished my food. She then told us she was sorry for not really tending to us because she had to make sure she was getting home somehow, as if it were our responsibility to get her home on time. Oh! And also while she was dropping off our food with another server the other server said "dude we are never getting out of here" which I'm sorry but that is ridiculous. We weren't even the last table in there! How rude.

This TGI Friday's is adjacent to Street Road but enter from Richlieu Road using the entrance it shares with a hotel. Parking was adequate when I was there on Saturday night. In fact, I was able to park a stone's throw from the front door, which may mean it is not that popular. The dining area is a bit too dark. I asked for a table with a brighter lamp because otherwise, I wouldn't even be able to read the menu. Aside from that, service was good enough. The server suggested the Stripes Card freebie even before I thought of asking, and then it wasn't too long before the wedge salad and entree (Parmesan Crusted Crab Flounder) arrived. The food itself didn't have terribly much flavor but it was about average for this restaurant chain. All in all, it was worth a stop because I was in the area. It probably is not a restaurant I would seek out and travel to, but it is decent.

So I know when you go here you get boxed/frozen food so the bar is low.  The problem is that this place was so far below the bar it isn't even funny.... The server took forever to get drinks to us or even acknowledge that we were there and I had to go get my own silverware.  Because she ran by without checking on us.  Next the food came out wrong, my buddy got the wrong wings, finally when the entrees came out sizzling chicken and cheese was far from sizzling in fact it was a slice of American cheese under a chewy gross chicken breast.  And the potatoes, well they had no taste and a bad texture.  From there no sign of the waitress until I asked for the manager and her response was lackluster and his was as well.

Came here with the boyfriend and his friends for a double date night. Nikki and I tried the Pink Punk Cosmo, which is a very interesting cocktail that requires the bartender to pour the liquor concoction into a cosmo glass filled with cotton candy. Pretty darn awesome if you ask me! Then we had our typical 3 for $12.99 dinners (with green bean fries, various entrees, and cheesecake) while his friends had fried shrimp and mashed potatoes. Luckily for us, his friend had a 20% off coupon for the table so it was a great deal cheaper than what it would have been (those drinks really add up!) All in all, it was pretty good service and pretty good food, I'd stop by again if I was in the area.

I have been coming to Friday's for many years and never leave hungry! I like the atmosphere and speediness of the food. Unfortunately the drinks that come from the bar tend to take some time.  Our server was great. She was very friendly, explained the awesome endless apps, and gave us fantastic recommendations for entrée & dessert options. I am pretty sure her name is Kristen.   I see a lot of not so good reviews here with my fellow yelpers and that just disappoints me. This place always meets the standards that are expected from TGI Friday's. This location is in a great spot and it is always clean and I like the way to is set up. All the servers or runners or managers also seem to help each other which is nice to see opposed to a whole restaurant having tension so thick you could cut it with a chain saw.    That's always awkward, annoying, and unprofessional. And those are things that I do not witness here at Friday's. Thanks Kristen for the great service, professionalism, and yummy recommendations. Chase also introduced himself and was very helpful while running our food out to us. Great team work guys!!

Went in for dessert after seeing a show. Had to wait quite a while to be seated. The waitress was ok but rather slow. The decaf coffee tasted like instant and the cheesecake tasted like someone mixed vanilla cake mix with cream cheese

LOVED my server, Drew. Very, very nice staff. The food is fabulous. I have nothing really to complain about except the kitchen staff because they gave me a dirty fork. Other than that, everyone you have to personally deal with was wonderful.

Friday at 530 not busy at all burgers took way to long to come to our table like 25 minuets they were dry and not good at all also music way to loud had to yell at my wife so she could listen to me. bye bye  wont be back here
Sat at our table for nearly 10 minutes without a waitress coming over while two of them sat and chatted 10 feet from our table. Finally got up and left.

First time in a long time at TGI Fridays.  I remember it being tasteless.  This time around the food was actually good.  The steak was cook as requested and not overly done.  The mash didnt taste like it was made from powder either.  I can see they care about what they put out and not just any kind of slop.  The dessert was very good.  I had gotten the cheese cake, even though I didnt need to eat it lol.   Happy Eatings!!
Dont go here on Thursday game night terribly loud cant even hear the server let alone each other, the mc loves his voice i guess.

Still one star, only because I could not give it half a star. Departmental lunch ended with 2 out of 3 people who ordered shrimp being out of work for a day and a half with food poisoning. Endless lunch is endless only because it takes waiter 20 minutes to get you a refil of soup.

Friday night ritual after playing pool with the guys.  Caroline is awesome (unfortunately she doesn't work at this location anymore) food is always good and atmosphere is typical bar/grill and very friendly.  Staff is excellent and knowledgable about the food and drinks they serve. Overall A great dining experience.
Their food has improved. The chipotle Yucatan chicken salad was tasty. So were the fries.

After a long work day and being stuck in a 3-hour traffic jam, I decided to swing in here to veg out and grab some grub to wind down. Because of the traffic I was in a crappy mood, so I came in with an edge. Anyway, I sat at the bar and got waited on right away - service was great.  Then I ordered the burger with the Jack Daniel's sauce - woah that stuff is good.  The burger itself is nothing special, however, the Jack Daniel's sauce is what makes it.  After all - it's a chain restaurant burger.  Long story short - it was a solid experience and for the top service I gotta give it 4 stars.
TGIF is a franchise if you have ever been to a TGIF it is the same atmosphere and food as them all. Service is good, especially from the experienced servers.

We ate here over the weekend after we saw the Jack Daniel commercials. It is the closest Friday's to us. The restaurant is tucked away a bit so I thought is would be empty. But this place was bustling with people! The Hostesses were so nice and clean cut girls (opposed to some other restaurants we have been to) we sat at the bar until our table was ready and the drinks were great. I was so glad we went because the Jack Daniels burger was FABULOUS! My only bad comment would have to be the wait! This place was packed! But it could just be because the food was good :)

We come here sometimes, but prefer to do take-out.  The service is kind of hit-or-miss, some were really nice, some were really rude.  The TGI Friday policy on coupons is always annoying but we don't push the issue or anything.  We've had ants on our tables twice, and the menu is always sticky.  Some of the food is good and some is just okay.  And the place is usually really loud.  But it's a nice place to just go out to and get a drink and some food.  The jack daniels bbq burger is delicious!
Service is hit or miss. Food isn't bad, but isn't great either. I don't have a lot of bad things to say about this place, but I don't have anything good to say either.

FYI: this place is better than the one in queens, ny I go to when I'm in nyc in terms of the atmosphere. we like jack daniel sauce and the bar atmosphere to celebrate the end of work week. What i don't like with TGI Friday's is the dessert selection. It's lame. And that's why I always skip the desset - it's not worth the money. They need to come up with better healthy and delicious dessert. And you don't have to ask 'would you care for dessert?' or How 'bout dessert?'

Years ago I would have given Friday's 4-5 stars.  Other than your family owned restaurants, they were a new game in town!  They started a lot of things..  chains, cool new appetizers, a huge center bar, an American  menu with variety.  A great place to pick up or get picked up ;+} They own the claim to much, like their Potato Skins even though since then, we have had better.  Their Jack Daniel's grill items were and still are a huge hit. I used to love their burgers, but there are too many better burger places now.  I love their Tostados Nacho's,  a layered creation of ground beef, refried beans, chips, salsa, jalapenos and cheese,  served with guacamole and sour cream. Yum. The first Friday's was opened in NYC by a perfume salesman, in 1965 and used a chalkboard for it's menu.  The revenues for the first year totaled 1 million dollars! It took him five years to open his second restaurant in Memphis, Tn. Today it is a worldwide chain and 600 of them are in the United States.

I still think its better than applebees for sure. The waitress was great and kept coming back to see if we were ok. The food was made well for a chain restaurant. Had a drink that was called a raspberry long island Ice tea with real raspberries in it. It was pretty good.  All in all a good place for quick bite to eat or grab a drink while watching the game.

I've been going to TGI Friday's for quite a few years.  I do like their salads alot.  It's a clean restaurant and you never have to wait to long for service.  I don't eat chicken fingers much anymore but they do have very good ones here with different sauces you can get for them.  I rate this on the level of applebee's.

I went here with my dad and it was a bad experience. It took ten min just to seat us and the place wasn't packed. After seating us, two waitresses came over because one was new and didn't know what to do. They took our orders but took forever to understand exactly what we wanted, we didn't even want anything complicated. The one waitress just couldnt understand the other, wtf. My dad ordered pasta that originally comes with chicken, but he doesnt eat meat so he asked for extra pasta instead of the chicken. I ordered moterzalla sticks and chicken fingers. His pasta was small and looked no where near like they had put extra pasta in it. So bascically we paid for a full dish but only got half. The moterzalla sticks were nasty, and tasted cold. The chicken fingers tasted horrible, like they weren't cooked all the way. We had also gotten fries that were cold. The waitresses didn't come back at all to check up on us, we had to flag them down to get our check. It was expensive for no reason,the food and service sucked. Don't bother eating here, you won't finish your food because of how cold it is, and you'll waste your money for nothing.

I would like to preface this review by saying, I love the fridays franchise.  The Fridays by the Cherry hill mall is one of my favorite places to stop before a movie.   On to the review:  My brother and I had some work to get done and were on a tight deadline so we decided to go to Fridays to get a quick bite and a drink to get our minds back on track.  Although my favorite new restaurant is right down the road (Toscana 52) it was around dinner time and the place is really busy and, like I said, we were in a hurry. We arrived at Fridays and squeezed in a place at the bar.  The bar was SMOKEY.  I say that as a warning, BUT I don't hold it against them since smoking is still allowed in restaurants in that area and to take any stars off for that would be unfair.  The bar was crowded, but lacked any kind of a warm feeling.  Unlike other Friday's I've been to, the ambiance was dark and uninviting. They had a full bar and the bar is BIG.  With a full bar they had 2 bar tenders and a barback(I think that's what they're called. A gopher type person).  We sat at the bar for about 20 minutes BEFORE the bartender took our order. His service sounded something like this, "Want something to drink?" Now, I understand that you can get busy and if I was at a bar in philly I wouldn't think twice about it. But seriously. It's a bar/restaurant and must be held to a higher standard.  I ordered a Sangria and my brother ordered a long island iced tea.  The sangria was watered down and tasted like cool aid. My brother had no complaints with his LIT. For entree's, we got the Fajita and the fish taco (fish taco for him obviously. If you've read any of my reviews, you know I hate fish). My fajita was sub par and it took around 45 minutes to get there.  My brother looked particularly green and was unable to finish his fish taco.  I assumed this was the case because it was a fish taco. I mean, come on. Does that even sound appetizing? But my brother assured me he had it at other Friday's and liked it.  In short, I reccomend you stop by your local Fridays for a quick bite, or a nice drink.  Just  so long as you don't live near this one.
